summary: This is an email from a prosecutor announcing the opening of the trial against Ghislaine Maxwell, emphasizing the pursuit of justice for historical sex crimes and providing logistical details for attending the trial in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused individual on trial for sexually exploiting underage girls.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Opening
events.description: The trial of Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin with peremptory challenges, preliminary instructions, and opening statements.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a prosecutor's statement asserting that Ghislaine Maxwell sexually exploited underage girls and caused harm to vulnerable children.
The trial is being held in the Southern District of New York, with the prosecutor emphasizing it is 'never too late for justice' even for crimes dating back to 1994.
Brave women are expected to testify as witnesses in the trial.
Logistical details for the trial's opening day are provided, including multiple overflow courtrooms and an early start time of 8:30 a.m.
